oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Maria Dominguez Roldan about Cuba after the revolution
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter to Elise Croft from her friend Maria Luisa Dominguez Roldan. Maria enthusiastically describes the Revolution and the changes in Cuban society, then asks for an introduction to the U.S. Ambassador to Cuba, Philip Bonsal. Stamps on the envelope depict Maria's father, Dr. Francisco Dominguez Roldan, who introduced radiology to the island and fought in the Cuban War of Independence.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Dominguez Roldan, Maria Luisa
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Correspondence; Cuba--Politics and government; Bonsal, Philip W. (Philip Wilson), 1903-1995
